text: Luis Proto Barbosa was an Indian politician from the state of Goa. He served as the Chief Minister of Goa for eight months in 1990. Barbosa was a member of the Indian National Congress. He played a significant role in the historic Opinion Poll of 1967. He was one of the members elected to the first legislative assembly constituted after Goa's Liberation from Portuguese rule. He was also a doctor."Politician who got elected for his sincerity ". Times of India. 11 October 2011. Barbosa headed a coalition government of 6 Congress defectors by joining in a coalition with the much larger 18 member Maharshtrawadi Gomantak Party. "Power games ". India Today. 15 August 1990.ORMER CM LUIS PROTO BARBOSA PASSES AWAY AT THE AGE OF 84 He was affectionately known as Poto Barboz. ==References== ==External links== * Goa Assembly - Chief Minister Profile, official version Category:Speakers of the Goa Legislative Assembly Category:Indian National Congress politicians from Goa Category:Chief Ministers of Goa Category:1927 births Category:2011 deaths Category:United Goans Party politicians Category:People from Margao
title: Luis Proto Barbosa
